com.topcoder.db.connectionfactory.producers
Class JDBCConnectionProducer

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.db.connectionfactory.producers.JDBCConnectionProducer
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConnectionProducer
public class JDBCConnectionProducer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConnectionProducer

A ConnectionProducer obtaining the connections to a database by the means specified by JDBC 1.0 specification, namely a DriverManager provided with a JDBC-compliant URL string and a connection properties is used to obtain a connections to a database.

This class provides a set of convenient constructors allowing to instantiate and initialize the JDBCConnectionProducer either programmatically or by providing the properties from configuration file. From version 1.1, the new constructor with a ConfigurationObject parameter supports creating the producer based on the configuration described with a ConfigurationObject instance.

This class requires only a JDBC-compliant URL string to be provided. Such an URL is used to obtain the connection to a database from a DriverManager. Optionally the client may specify the JDBC driver specific parameters to be passed to the JDBC driver matching the specified JDBC URL. Those parameters may include the username/password pair to be used to obtain a connections to a database.

Main Changes in version 1.1:
(1) The extra method declared in ConnectionProducer interface to allow clients obtaining connections that are authenticated with user-provided credentials rather than credentials recorded in producer configuration is implemented in this class.
(2) All the NullPointerException thrown are replaced with IllegalArgumentException.
(3) The old constructor with Property parameter is deprecated in this version, a new constructor is added to support creating the producer based on the configuration described with a ConfigurationObject instance.

Sample Configuration: 

   <Property name="parameters">
           <!--Optional-->
       <Property name="jdbc_driver">
            <Value>com.mysql.jdbc.Driver</Value>
       </Property>
       <!--required-->
       <Property name="jdbc_url">
           <Value>jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/tcs</Value>
       </Property>
           <!--Optional-->
       <Property name="user">
           <Value>root</Value>
       </Property>
           <!--Optional-->
       <Property name="password">
            <Value></Value>
       </Property>
  </Property>

Note: The Property and the ConfigurationObject used to initialize this class have the similar formats (see sample above). But the configuration from ConfigurationObject exists in the "parameters" child of the root configuration object.

Side Note : Empty String means the length of string after trimming equals to zero.

The specified Configuration(Property and ConfigurationObject) should at least contain a nested sub-property named as JDBC_URL_PROPERTY providing the JDBC URL to be used to obtain a connections to a database. Optionally the JDBC_DRIVER_CLASS_PROPERTY sub-property may provide the fully-qualified name of a JDBC driver class to be loaded and further used to obtain a connections to a database. All other sub-properties directly nested within specified Configuration(Property and ConfigurationObject) will be interpreted as an configuration properties to be used to configure the JDBC driver. These properties may specify the username/password pair to be used to connect to a database or any other parameters specific to a JDBC driver.

Thread Safety: This class is thread safe. The state of the each instance of this class is never changed after the instantiation during the lifetime of such an instance.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.1
Author:
isv, qiucx0161, nhzp339, magicpig

Field Detail

USERNAME_PROPERTY

public static final java.lang.String USERNAME_PROPERTY

The name for the property which stores the user name. It is immutable and will be used in constructors and createConnection(String, String) method.

Since:
1.1
See Also:
Constant Field Values

PASSWORD_PROPERTY

public static final java.lang.String PASSWORD_PROPERTY

The name for the property which stores the password. It is immutable and will be used in constructors and createConnection(String, String) method.

Since:
1.1
See Also:
Constant Field Values

JDBC_URL_PROPERTY

public static final java.lang.String JDBC_URL_PROPERTY

A String specifying the name of a configuration property providing the JDBC URL to be used to obtain the connections to a database. This field is immutable. It will be used in constructors.

This is a required property. If such a property is not specified by the configuration then the instantiation of JDBCConnectionProducer will fail.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

JDBC_DRIVER_CLASS_PROPERTY

public static final java.lang.String JDBC_DRIVER_CLASS_PROPERTY

A String specifying the name of a configuration property providing the fully-qualified name of a JDBC driver class to be loaded to obtain the connections to a database. This field is immutable. It will be used in constructors.

This is an optional property. If such a property is specified by the configuration then the created JDBCConnectionProducer will attempt to load the specified JDBC driver.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

JDBCConnectionProducer

public JDBCConnectionProducer(java.lang.String jdbcUrl)

Constructs new JDBCConnectionProducer with specified JDBC URL to be used to obtain a connections to a database. The provided URL should follow the format specified by JDBC 1.0 specification.

Parameters:
jdbcUrl - a String providing the JDBC-compliant URL to be used to obtain a connection to a database.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if specified argument is null or an empty String

JDBCConnectionProducer

public JDBCConnectionProducer(java.lang.String jdbcUrl,
                              java.lang.String username,
                              java.lang.String password)

Constructs new JDBCConnectionProducer with specified JDBC URL and a username/password pair to be used to obtain a connections to a database. The provided URL should follow the format specified by JDBC 1.0 specification.

Parameters:
jdbcUrl - a String providing the JDBC-compliant URL to be used to obtain a connection to a database. It can't be null or empty string.
username - a String providing the username to be used to obtain a connections to a database. It can't be null but can be empty string.
password - a String providing the password to be used to obtain a connections to a database. It can't be null but can be empty string.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if specified jdbcUrl, username or password is null; if specified jdbcUrl is an empty string

JDBCConnectionProducer

public JDBCConnectionProducer(java.lang.String jdbcUrl,
                              java.util.Properties properties)

Constructs new JDBCConnectionProducer with specified JDBC URL and connection properties to be used to obtain a connections to a database. The provided URL should follow the format specified by JDBC 1.0 specification. The provided Properties may provide the JDBC driver-specific parameters to be used to configure the driver when getting the connections to a database through the createConnection() method. If a username/password pair is provided then they should be mapped to a "user" and "password" keys respectively.

Parameters:
jdbcUrl - a String providing the JDBC-compliant URL to be used to obtain a connection to a database. It can't be null or empty string.
properties - a Properties providing the configuration parameters to be used to obtain a connections to a database. It can't be null but can be empty and there are no constraints on the keys/values of properties.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null or if the specified jdbcUrl is an empty string

JDBCConnectionProducer

public JDBCConnectionProducer(com.topcoder.util.config.Property properties)
                       throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Deprecated.  

Constructs new JDBCConnectionProducer which is initialized using the specified configuration properties. The purpose of this constructor is to instantiate the JDBCConnectionProducer from the parameters provided by a configuration file. Currently a DBConnectionFactoryImpl will invoke this constructor through Java Reflection API when being initialized with the parameters from configuration file.

Parameters:
properties - a Property providing the configuration properties to be used to initialize the JDBCConnectionProducer. It can't be null. The value for JDBC_URL_PROPERTY must be non-empty string. If the value for JDBC_DRIVER_CLASS_PROPERTY is provided, it must be a fully qualified class name.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if specified argument is null; if it does not contain a nested property named as JDBC_URL_PROPERTY or the value of such property is empty.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the properties contain driver class name, but the class name is invalid.

JDBCConnectionProducer

public JDBCConnectionProducer(com.topcoder.configuration.ConfigurationObject configurationObject)
                       throws com.topcoder.configuration.ConfigurationAccessException,
                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

Constructs a new JDBCConnectionProducer instance based on the configuration specified in a ConfigurationObject instance.

Parameters:
configurationObject - The object recording the configuration for this producer. It can't be null.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the properties contain driver class name, but the class name is invalid.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the configurationiObject parameter is null or the provided configuration is malformed.
com.topcoder.configuration.ConfigurationAccessException - if any error occurs while reading the configuration.
java.lang.LinkageError - if the linkage fails when loading the driver
java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError - if the initialization fails when loading the driver
Since:
1.1
Method Detail

createConnection

public java.sql.Connection createConnection()
                                     throws DBConnectionException

Creates a connection to a database obtaining a connection from a DriverManager providing it with an JDBC URL and connection properties specified at construction time.

Specified by:
createConnection in interface ConnectionProducer
Returns:
a Connection providing the connection to a database; Will not be null.
Throws:
DBConnectionException - if any error occurs while creating a connection.

createConnection

public java.sql.Connection createConnection(java.lang.String username,
                                            java.lang.String password)
                                     throws DBConnectionException

Creates a connection from a DriverManager providing it with an JDBC URL and connection properties authenticated with the specified username and password.

Specified by:
createConnection in interface ConnectionProducer
Parameters:
username - The username with which to connect to the database. Can be any String instance including null and empty string.
password - The user's password. Can be any String instance including null and empty string.
Returns:
a Connection providing the connection to a database. Will not be null.
Throws:
DBConnectionException - if any error occurs while creating the connection.
Since:
1.1
